bibl.title: Letter from George E. Armstrong to Philip Showalter Hench, December 31, 1953

div1.p: Armstrong writes in regard to the Armed Forces Medical Library making a microfilm copy of Finlay's books which are at the Havana Academy of Sciences Library in Cuba. He encloses his letter to Jose A. Presno regarding the microfilms, and Hench's involvement.

div1.head: Letter from George E. Armstrong to Philip Showalter Hench, December 31, 1953
div1.opener:
DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE
DEPARTMENT OF THE ARMY
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON 25, D.C.
31 December 1953
IN REPLY REFER TO MEDCE-MI 201(Hench, Philip)0
Philip S. Hench, M.D.
Mayo Clinic
102-110 Second Ave., S.W.
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter dated 10 December 1953
concerning the eight or nine volumes of Dr. Carlos
Finlay's own day-book or diary which are now in the
possession of the Library of the Academy of Sciences
of Havana, Cuba. I agree that we should have a
microfilm of these volumes, for historical purposes
if nothing more.

I believe the facilities of the Armed Forces
Medical Library here in Washington will be able to
make microfilm much more inexpensively than anywhere
else in the world. If the volume could be brought or
sent here, the Library could make a microfilm for its
oen files and a copy to be sent to the Havana Academy
of Sciences Library, when the diaries are returned, as
a gift in appreciation for the courtesy of allowing us
to make the microfilm.

If the Havana Academy of Sciences Library authorities
are unwilling to allow the diaries to leave the country
and there are available in Cuba facilities for making
microfilm copies, the Armed Forces Medical Library will
be able to pay in the neighborhood of $90 to $115 fo
a microfilm positive or negative. If the cost were to
run much more than the figure quoted, it will be nec-
essary to get a special authorization from the Armed
Forces Medical Library before closing the deal so as
to be certain that you can be reimbursed for whatever
financial outlay you may have to make.

MEDCE-MI
31 December 1953
Philip S. Hench, M.D.

Inclosed is a copy of a letter I have addressed
to Dr. José Presno which authorizes you to act in my
behalf in this matter. I am grateful to you for call-
ing the Finlay diaries to my attention and I hope you
will be successful in your negotiations.
Please accept my best wishes for the New Year.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, GEORGE E. ARMSTRONG
Major General
The Surgeon General 1 Incl
Cy ltr to Dr. Presno
